snippet: Edward J. Snowden may have worked with Russian spy agencies while he was still a contractor for the National Security Agency, Representative Mike Rogers said.
abstract: Heads of House and Senate Intelligence Committees suggest that former National Security Agency contractor Edward J Snowden may have been working for Russian spy services while employed at agency facility in Hawaii in 2013, before he disclosed hundreds of thousands of classified government documents; no specific evidence is offered to support claims.

byline.original: By ERIC SCHMITT and DAVID E. SANGER

lead_paragraph: Edward J. Snowden may have worked with Russian spy agencies while he was still a contractor for the National Security Agency, Representative Mike Rogers said.

headline.main: Congressional Leaders Suggest Earlier Snowden Link to Russia
headline.print_headline: Lawmakers Suggest Snowden Link to Russia Before He Leaked Data
